use_cases_and_deployment_scope: We use 6sense to gain valuable sales insights and target high-potential accounts through its advanced keyword search and advertising capabilities. This platform helps us focus our efforts only on accounts that show genuine interest in our products, based on their online behavior and keyword activity. By identifying intent signals early, 6sense eliminates the need to prospect uninterested accounts, saving time and resources. Our primary use of the tool is for both sales insights and targeted advertising, enabling our teams to prioritize accounts more effectively and personalize outreach strategies based on real-time data.
pros: Intent data and keyword searches displayed by account; Advertising segments; Go-to-market alignment
likelihood_to_recommend: 6sense is great when used for sales insight, especially in scenarios where sales teams need to prioritize accounts based on buying intent. When we want to identify which accounts are actively researching a product category or specific keywords, 6sense provides visibility into anonymous website visits and intent signals. 6sense can do better in terms data enrichment—such as updating or verifying contact details before import to CRM. While 6sense offers some enrichment features, tools like ZoomInfo is generally more robust to maintaining accurate contact-level data.

likelihood_to_recommend: 6sense is highly useful for verticals in the B2B sphere. I would recommend the platform for organizations that are looking to drive free trials, or demo requests through paid marketing channels. For an organization that is optimizing for purchase events or in e-commerce, I would not recommend 6sense. Unless they are looking to target specific account types (Enterprise, SLED, SMB, etc). The platform is more suitable for organizations that have specific account type goals, more so an ABM focus. The platform has a robust ability to sync specific 1st party data, intent, and behavioral sources to various paid marketing channels (linkedin, meta, etc.). This has shifted the landscape on how we target users across our paid media channels.

use_cases_and_deployment_scope: I use it everyday to prospect and see which accounts are hot in my book of business. I start my day by looking at the recent activities and then I move on to the hot new and hot accounts.
pros: One of 6sense’s biggest strengths is its ability to uncover anonymous website visitors and match them to accounts within a target list.; 6sense’s AI models classify accounts into buying stages like Awareness, Consideration, Decision, or Purchase-ready.; 6sense integrates smoothly with key platforms like Salesforce, HubSpot, Outreach, Marketo, and LinkedIn, ensuring that data flows easily between tools and users can take action within their existing workflows.
cons: updates earlier in the morning; more reliable data
likelihood_to_recommend: It’s highly effective when deciding when to reach out to an account — especially if it surfaces that an account is moving into a higher intent stage (like “Decision” or “Consideration”), signaling it’s a good time to engage. 6sense is excellent for surfacing which ones are actively showing intent signals (like researching keywords, visiting competitors’ sites, or engaging with relevant content). Occasionally, 6sense might flag intent when an account isn’t actually close to being sales-ready — for example, if a prospect is doing research for a long-term initiative. In those cases, intent signals alone shouldn’t dictate engagement strategy without qualification through conversation.
